Author:
pgautam The application uses this to do all the nitty gritty DB stuffs Back to the future Note: Later, need to move to ContentProvider but since there \ are no plans to share with any other Application yet, nyah...

Method Detail

open

public DBHelper open()
              throws SQLException
Open the posit database. If it cannot be opened, try to create a new instance of the database. If it cannot be created, throw an exception to signal the failure

Returns:
this (self reference, allowing this to be chained in an initialization call)
Throws:
SQLException - if the database could be neither opened or created

close

public void close()
Close the db, save some memory, energy... you know the usual mumbo jumbo.

updateRow

public boolean updateRow(long rowId,
                         java.lang.String desc,
                         java.lang.String lon,
                         java.lang.String lat,
                         java.lang.String type)
Update the row using the details provided. The row to be updated is specified using the rowId, and it is altered to use the title and desc values passed in

Parameters:
rowId - id of note to update
title - value to set note title to
body - value to set note body to
Returns:
true if the note was successfully updated, false otherwise

public long addSighting(java.lang.Double latitude,
                        java.lang.Double longitude,
                        java.lang.String typeOfSighting,
                        java.lang.String description)
Add sightings based on the

Parameters:
latitude - latitude value @type Double they're intended to be null if no device is detected
longitude - longitude value @type Double
typeOfSighting - type of sighting. How it was seen by the observer.. using telemetry, radio or whatever
description - Description of the sighting, intended to be optional but will be useful nonetheless
Returns:

getIdForAdapterPosition

public long getIdForAdapterPosition(int position)
Gets Id for a given Adapter Position, if it's not directly linked by CursorAdapter or something similar as is the case with Spinners sometimes. selects the first row after the provided parameter position Cursor c = db.rawQuery("SELECT "+KEY_ROWID+" FROM "+ MAIN_TABLE+ " LIMIT 1 OFFSET "+position, null);

Parameters:
position -
Returns:
